description: Sebastian went missing in Chippenham, Wiltshire, last Thursday with a large search operation underway.
title: 'Please help us find our much-loved son'
title_page: Sebastian Sailes: 'Please help us find our much-loved son' - BBC News
maintext:
The family of a missing 21-year-old man, last seen six days ago, have appealed to the public for fresh information about the whereabouts of their "much-loved son".
Sebastian Sailes was last seen at Lovers Walk, Chippenham, Wiltshire, at 23:30 GMT last Thursday, and is thought to have then headed along Avon Valley Walk towards his home in Notton.
A large operation has been launched, with scores of volunteers joining police in the search.
His family said: "We are a very close family and are all extremely anxious and praying for the safe return of our much-loved son Sebastian."
Ch Insp Ben Huggins said police are urging anyone with relevant information to come forward.
"Many of our enquiries have taken place around the river but we are also investigating the possibility that he has made his way towards Rowden Hill and through the new estates," he said.
Seb was wearing a beige jacket, light blue jeans and white trainers.
Ch Insp Huggins has urged people to check their doorbell footage. He also appealed to motorists - including delivery and taxis drivers - to look at their dashcam video.
